{"blocks":[{"key":"7ga5d","text":"The number of PCR cycles should be chosen based on input amount and sample type (see Table 7). Thus, samples prepared with a different method prior to library prep may require re-optimization of the number of PCR cycles. The number of cycles should be high enough to provide sufficient library fragments for a successful sequencing run, but low enough to avoid PCR artifacts and over-cycling (high molecular weight fragments on TapeStation or Fragment Analyzer). Use the table below for applications requiring high library yields (~ steps.section: Measuring libraries and equimolar pooling of samples
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4aip7","text":"Measure the concentration of all samples on the Fragment Analyzer. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"diov9","text":"Export a smear analysis and pool all samples equimolarly by either using the Qiagility pipetting robot or manually.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e323","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blvld","text":"Measure the pool(s) in triplicate on the TapeStation using the High Sensitivity D5000 kit.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nmi1","text":"Use the mean concentration per pool for calculations.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vhrf","text":"If equimolar pooling of subpools is required, use the average molar concentration of the three measured subpools for pooling of these pools (calculate this based on the lowest pool concentration).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
